text:
I found that the REPL outputs of `@code_llvm` and `@code_native` are with syntax highlight in Julia 1.6.
But, that of `@macroexpand` is w/o highlight even in 1.6, and sometime it is hard to read…
Is there any plan or way to support syntax highlight for `@macroexpand` output?

text: We don't currently implement highlighting of Julia code in base, but maybe we should? OhMyREPL does have syntax highlighting, so it probably wouldn't be hard to put something together yourself using that.

elements.text: We don't currently implement highlighting of Julia code in base, but maybe we should? OhMyREPL does have syntax highlighting, so it probably wouldn't be hard to put something together yourself using that.

text:
I found `test_colorscheme(color_scheme_name::String, test_string::String)` in `OhMyREPL`.
So,
```s = @macroexpand ...
test_colorscheme("Monokai16", string(s))```
works well.
Thanks!!!
Cool! Might even want to make a PR to OhMyREPL with this, since it seems useful.

elements.text: Cool! Might even want to make a PR to OhMyREPL with this, since it seems useful.
